query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 «O Padre nostro, che ne’ cieli stai, 2 non circunscritto, ma per più amore 3 ch’ai primi effetti di là sù tu hai,
4 laudato sia ’l tuo nome e ’l tuo valore 5 da ogne creatura, com’ è degno 6 di render grazie al tuo dolce vapore.
query.result:
**English:**
1 "Our Father, who art in the heavens, 2 not circumscribed, but for greater love 3 that thou hast for thy first effects,
4 praised be thy name and thy worth 5 by every creature, as is meet 6 to render thanks for thy sweet breath.
**Sanskrit:**
1 "He pita naḥ, yaḥ svargeṣu sthitaḥ asi, 2 na paricchinnaḥ, api tu adhika-premaṇā 3 yān ādi-kāryāṇi tatra upari tvayā sṛṣṭāni,
4 tava nāma ca tava ca mahimā 5 sarvaiḥ prajābhiḥ stūyete, yathā ucitam 6 tava svādu-vāyu-nimittam kṛtajñatāṃ darśayitum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Vegna ver’ noi la pace del tuo regno, 8 ché noi ad essa non potem da noi, 9 s’ella non vien, con tutto nostro ingegno.
query.result:
**English:**
7 May the peace of your kingdom come to us, 8 for we cannot attain it by ourselves, 9 even with all our efforts, unless it comes to us.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Āgacchatv asmāsu rājyasyasya śāntiḥ, 8 Yataḥ asmābhiḥ svayam eva na śakyate sā prāptum, 9 Yady apy asmābhiḥ sarvaḥ prayatnaḥ kṛtaḥ syāt, tathāpi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Come del suo voler li angeli tuoi 11 fan sacrificio a te, cantando osanna, 12 così facciano li uomini de’ suoi.
query.result:
**English:**
10 As Your angels make sacrifice to You of their own will, singing hosanna, 11 so may men do of theirs.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Yathā tava icchāyā tava devatāḥ 11 tava stutiṃ kurvanti, oṃkāraṃ japanti, 12 tathā manuṣyā api tava stutiṃ kuryuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Dà oggi a noi la cotidiana manna, 14 sanza la qual per questo aspro diserto 15 a retro va chi più di gir s’affanna.
query.result:
**English:**
13 Give us this day our daily bread, 14 without which in this harsh desert 15 he who strives to go forward goes backward.
**Sanskrit:**
13 Adya asmākam nityam annam dehi, 14 yena vinā asmin kaṭhore marubhūmau 15 pratyag eva gacchati yaḥ adhikam gantum icchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 E come noi lo mal ch’avem sofferto 17 perdoniamo a ciascuno, e tu perdona 18 benigno, e non guardar lo nostro merto.
query.result:
**English:**
16 And as we pardon each other the evil that we have suffered, 17 do thou also pardon us, and be gracious, 18 and do not look at our merit.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Eva ca yathā vayam duḥkham yat prāptam asmabhiḥ 17 Kṣamayāmaḥ sarveṣām, evam tvam api kṣamasva 18 Prasannacittaḥ, na ca paśya naḥ puṇyam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Nostra virtù che di legger s’adona, 20 non spermentar con l’antico avversaro, 21 ma libera da lui che sì la sprona.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Our virtue, which is easily overcome, 20 do not test with the ancient adversary, 21 but free yourself from him who spurs it on.
**Sanskrit:**
19 Naśā śaktir yasya laghutvāt praharṣaṇīyā, 20 na parīkṣetavyā pūrvaśatreṇa, 21 kim tu vimoktavyaḥ sa yena pravṛttā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Quest’ ultima preghiera, segnor caro, 23 già non si fa per noi, ché non bisogna, 24 ma per color che dietro a noi restaro».
query.result:
**English:**
22 This last prayer, dear Lord, 23 is not made for us, for we have no need, 24 but for those who will remain after us.
**Sanskrit:**
22 Ayam antimaḥ prārthanā, deva priya, 23 Adhunā na kartavyā asmābhiḥ, na hi āvaśyakam asti, 24 Api tu teṣām ye asmābhiḥ paścāt sthāsyanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Così a sé e noi buona ramogna 26 quell’ ombre orando, andavan sotto ’l pondo, 27 simile a quel che talvolta si sogna,
28 disparmente angosciate tutte a tondo 29 e lasse su per la prima cornice, 30 purgando la caligine del mondo.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Thus to themselves and us good riddance 26 those shades were praying, and went beneath the burden, 27 similar to what one sometimes dreams,
28 variously anguished all around 29 and weary on the first ledge, 30 purging the darkness of the world.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Evam ātmane naḥ ca śubhābhivādanaṃ 26 tāḥ chāyāḥ prārthayantyaḥ bhāraṃ bibhratyaḥ prayānti sma, 27 yathā kadācit svapne dṛśyate,
28 viśeṣeṇa piḍitāḥ sarvataḥ paritaḥ 29 śrāntāḥ ca prathame bhūmaṇḍale, 30 jagataḥ tamaḥ praśamayantyaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Se di là sempre ben per noi si dice, 32 di qua che dire e far per lor si puote 33 da quei c’hanno al voler buona radice?
34 Ben si de’ loro atar lavar le note 35 che portar quinci, sì che, mondi e lievi, 36 possano uscire a le stellate ruote.
query.result:
**English:**
31 If good is always spoken of them there, 32 what can be said and done for them here 33 by those whose will is rooted in goodness?
34 Their names should indeed be cleansed of the stains 35 that they carry from this world, so that, pure and light, 36 they may ascend to the starry spheres.
**Sanskrit:**
31 Yadi tatra sadā asmākaṃ viṣaye śubham eva ucyate, 32 atra kim ucyatām kṛtam vā teṣāṃ viṣaye 33 taiḥ yeṣāṃ śubhā mūlaṃ icchāyām asti?
34 Teṣāṃ nāmadheyair eva doṣāḥ praksiptavyāḥ 35 ye atra loke dhṛtāḥ, yathā, śuddha-laghvīkṛtāḥ, 36 te tārāgaṇa-maṇḍalāni prāpnuvanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 «Deh, se giustizia e pietà vi disgrievi 38 tosto, sì che possiate muover l’ala, 39 che secondo il disio vostro vi lievi,
40 mostrate da qual mano inver’ la scala 41 si va più corto; e se c’è più d’un varco, 42 quel ne ’nsegnate che men erto cala;
43 ché questi che vien meco, per lo ’ncarco 44 de la carne d’Adamo onde si veste, 45 al montar sù, contra sua voglia, è parco».
query.result:
**English:**
37 "Ah, if justice and pity move you, 38 quickly, so that you may move your wings, 39 that you may rise according to your desire,
40 show us from which hand toward the stairway 41 one goes more quickly; and if there is more than one passage, 42 teach us the one that descends less steeply;
43 for this one who comes with me, because of the burden 44 of the flesh of Adam with which he is clothed, 45 is slow to climb, against his will."
**Sanskrit:**
37 "Aha, yadi nyāyo dayā ca bhavānāvapi duḥkhitau bhavataḥ, 38 kṣipram, yathā bhavābhyāṃ pakṣau calayitum śakyate, 39 yathā bhavābhyāṃ kāmanusarataḥ utthātum śakyate,
40 tadā, śṛṇuta, kadambasya diśi kaḥ panthāḥ 41 adhikaṃ samīpaḥ asti; yadi ca ekatvādhikaḥ panthāḥ asti, 42 tadā, asmābhiḥ saḥ panthāḥ upadeśyatām yaḥ adhikaṃ mandabhūmiṣṭhaḥ asti;
43 ayam hi yaḥ mama sahacaraḥ asti, Ādamasya māṃsasaḥ bhāreṇa, 44 yena ayam veṣṭitaḥ asti, 45 ūrdhvam ārohaṇe, svakīyāniṣṭayā, mandabhāvitaḥ asti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 E s’io non fossi impedito dal sasso 53 che la cervice mia superba doma, 54 onde portar convienmi il viso basso,
55 cotesti, ch’ancor vive e non si noma, 56 guardere’ io, per veder s’i’ ’l conosco, 57 e per farlo pietoso a questa soma.
query.result:
**English:**
52 And if I were not impeded by the rock 53 that humbles my proud neck, 54 so that I am forced to keep my face down,
55 I would look at those who are still alive and not named, 56 to see if I recognize them, 57 and to make them feel pity for this burden.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Atha yadi aham na syām pratihataḥ śilena 53 yat mama garvam vinamrayati, 54 yena mama mukham adhomukham sthātavyam,
55 etān, ye adyāpi jīvanti na ca nāmadheyena ucyante, 56 paśyemaham, jñātum artham kim aham etān jānāmi, 57 evaṃ ca etān mama duḥkhe dayālūn kuryām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Io fui latino e nato d’un gran Tosco: 59 Guiglielmo Aldobrandesco fu mio padre; 60 non so se ’l nome suo già mai fu vosco.
query.result:
**English:**
58 I was Latin and born of a great Tuscan: 59 Guglielmo Aldobrandesco was my father; 60 I do not know if his name ever reached you.
**Sanskrit:**
58 Aham lātīnaḥ āsam jātaśca asmi mahato toskasya: 59 Guiglielmo Aldobrandesco āsīt me pitā; 60 Na jānāmi kim tasya nāma kadācit tvām agāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 L’antico sangue e l’opere leggiadre 62 d’i miei maggior mi fer sì arrogante, 63 che, non pensando a la comune madre,
64 ogn’ uomo ebbi in despetto tanto avante, 65 ch’io ne mori’, come i Sanesi sanno, 66 e sallo in Campagnatico ogne fante.
query.result:
**English:**
61 My ancient blood and the noble deeds 62 of my ancestors made me so arrogant, 63 that, not thinking of our common mother,
64 I held every man in such great contempt, 65 that I killed him, as the people of Siena know, 66 and every foot soldier in Campagnatico knows it.
**Sanskrit:**
61 Mama pūrvajaḥ rudhiraḥ tathā śubhakarmāṇi 62 Mama pūrvajānāṃ mama ahaṃkāraṃ vardhayanti sma, 63 Yataḥ mama sāmānya-jananīṃ na smaran,
64 Mama sarveṣu manuṣyeṣu tiryak-dṛṣṭiḥ āsīt, 65 Yataḥ aham teṣāṃ vadhaṃ cakāra, yathā Saineyāḥ jānanti, 66 Tathā Campagnatico-sthitaḥ pratyekasya pādātika-sainikasya jñānam asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Io sono Omberto; e non pur a me danno 68 superbia fa, ché tutti miei consorti 69 ha ella tratti seco nel malanno.
query.result:
**English:**
67 I am Omberto; and not to me alone 68 does pride do harm, for it has dragged 69 all my companions with it into misfortune.
**Sanskrit:**
67 Aham Omberto; na ca me evaika eva 68 abhimānaḥ karoti hānim, yataḥ sarvān mama sahacārān 69 sa apanītaḥ pāpakarmani.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 E qui convien ch’io questo peso porti 71 per lei, tanto che a Dio si sodisfaccia, 72 poi ch’io nol fe’ tra ’ vivi, qui tra ’ morti».
query.result:
**English:**
70 And here it is necessary that I bear this burden 71 for her, until God is satisfied, 72 since I did not do it among the living, here among the dead."
**Sanskrit:**
70 Atra ca me ayam bhāraḥ dhātavyaḥ 71 asyāḥ, yāvat Devāya santuṣṭiḥ bhavati, 72 yasmāt aham na cakāraḥ jīvantaḥ, atra mṛtaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Ascoltando chinai in giù la faccia; 74 e un di lor, non questi che parlava, 75 si torse sotto il peso che li ’mpaccia,
76 e videmi e conobbemi e chiamava, 77 tenendo li occhi con fatica fisi 78 a me che tutto chin con loro andava.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Listening, I bowed my face; 74 and one of them, not the one who was speaking, 75 turned under the weight that encumbers them,
76 and saw me and recognized me and called out to me, 77 keeping his eyes fixed on me with difficulty, 78 as I walked, completely bowed down, with them.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Śṛṇvantam śira ādhomukham; 74 Ekaś ca teṣām, na ayam yaḥ provāca, 75 Avavartata subhāreṇa yaḥ tam ākrāmati,
76 Mama ca darśanam alabhata jñānam ca alabhata āha ca, 77 Netre mayā saha sarvakālaṃ samyukte samyak prayatnena dhārayan, 78 Mama yaḥ saha sarvakālaṃ samyuktaḥ āgacchati.
Please note that the Sanskrit translation is a more literal rendering of the Italian text, and may not be as idiomatic or natural-sounding as a more literary translation.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 «Oh!», diss’ io lui, «non se’ tu Oderisi, 80 l’onor d’Agobbio e l’onor di quell’ arte 81 ch’alluminar chiamata è in Parisi?».
query.result:
**English:**
79 "Oh!", I said to him, "aren't you Oderisi, 80 the honor of Gubbio and the honor of that art 81 that is called 'illuminating' in Paris?"
**Sanskrit:**
79 "Aha!", ahaṃ tasmai uvāca, "na tvamasi Oderisi, 80 Agobbio-mahimā tathaiva sā vidyā-mahimā ca, 81 yā Parisi nagare 'ālokanā' iti abhidhīyate?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 «Frate», diss’ elli, «più ridon le carte 83 che pennelleggia Franco Bolognese; 84 l’onore è tutto or suo, e mio in parte.
query.result:
**English:**
82 "Brother," he said, "the cards laugh more 83 than Franco Bolognese's paintbrush; 84 the honor is all his now, and mine in part.
**Sanskrit:**
82 "Bhrātar," saḥ uvāca, "adhikaṃ hasanti pattāḥ 83 yaḥ Franco Bolognese vartayati tulikām; 84 yasya sarvaḥ ayaṃ adhikaḥ sammānaḥ, mama tu kevalam aṃśataḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Ben non sare’ io stato sì cortese 86 mentre ch’io vissi, per lo gran disio 87 de l’eccellenza ove mio core intese.
query.result:
**English:**
85 But I was not so courteous 86 while I lived, because of the great desire 87 for the excellence to which my heart aspired.
**Sanskrit:**
85 Na tu khalu aham tathāvidhaḥ sādhuḥ āsam 86 Yāvad aham jīvitaḥ āsīt, mahatyābhilāṣeṇa 87 Viśiṣṭasya yasmin mama cittaṃ niviṣṭam āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Di tal superbia qui si paga il fio; 89 e ancor non sarei qui, se non fosse 90 che, possendo peccar, mi volsi a Dio.
query.result:
**English:**
88 For such pride one pays the penalty here; 89 and I would not be here now, if it were not 90 that, having the power to sin, I turned to God.
**Sanskrit:**
88 Tasyāhaṅkārasya atra daṇḍaḥ prāpyate; 89 Na ca aham atra bhaveyam, yadi na syāt 90 Yat pāpaṃ kartum śaknuvan ahaṃ devam āśritya pravṛttaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Oh vana gloria de l’umane posse! 92 com’ poco verde in su la cima dura, 93 se non è giunta da l’etati grosse!
94 Credette Cimabue ne la pittura 95 tener lo campo, e ora ha Giotto il grido, 96 sì che la fama di colui è scura.
query.result:
**English:**
91 Oh, vain glory of human power! 92 How little green remains upon the top, 93 if it is not reached by the great ages!
94 Cimabue thought he held the field in painting, 95 and now Giotto has the cry, 96 so that the fame of the former is obscured.
**Sanskrit:**
91 Ahaṃ mānuṣī śaktir mṛṣā vaibhavaṃ ca! 92 Śikhara-agre kaḥ śākhā-pallava-śobhā-sthitiḥ, 93 Yadi na prāptā purātanaiḥ kālaiḥ!
94 Cimabue citrakarmaṇi kṣetraṃ dhṛtavanta iti manyate sma, 95 Adhunā tu Giotto kīrtiḥ pravartate, 96 Yataḥ pūrvasya yaśaḥ kṣīṇam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Così ha tolto l’uno a l’altro Guido 98 la gloria de la lingua; e forse è nato 99 chi l’uno e l’altro caccerà del nido.
query.result:
**English:**
97 Thus one Guido has taken from the other 98 the glory of the language; and perhaps one is born 99 who will drive both of them from the nest.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Evam ekasya Guidoḥ aparasya 98 bhāṣāyāḥ kīrtim apahṛtaḥ; ca api kimcid asti jātaḥ 99 yaḥ ubhau api nidāt niṣkāṣayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Non è il mondan romore altro ch’un fiato 101 di vento, ch’or vien quinci e or vien quindi, 102 e muta nome perché muta lato.
query.result:
**English:**
100 The worldly clamor is nothing but a breath 101 of wind, which now comes from here and now from there, 102 and changes name because it changes direction.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Na khalu laukikaḥ śabdaḥ anyat kiṃcid vāyoh śvāsaḥ, 101 yaḥ adhunā atra āgacchati, adhunā atra, 102 nāma ca vikurute yadi vikurute diśam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Che voce avrai tu più, se vecchia scindi 104 da te la carne, che se fossi morto 105 anzi che tu lasciassi il ‘pappo’ e ’l ‘dindi’,
106 pria che passin mill’ anni? ch’è più corto 107 spazio a l’etterno, ch’un muover di ciglia 108 al cerchio che più tardi in cielo è torto.
query.result:
**English:**
103 What more voice will you have, if, when old, you separate 104 the flesh from yourself, than if you had died 105 before you left behind the ‘pap’ and the ‘dinars’,
106 before a thousand years pass? For shorter 107 is the space of time to eternity than the movement of an eyelid 108 to the circle that is drawn latest in the sky.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Kim vācyam bhavataḥ, yadi jarayā viyojayasi 104 śarīramātmanaḥ, yadi vā mṛto bhaveḥ 105 pūrvam eva ‘pappa’ ‘dīnāra’ ca parityaktvā,
106 pūrvam eva sahasrasya varṣāṇām vyatīteḥ? Yataḥ anantāya kālāya lakṣyamāṇasya kālasya alpamātram asti, 108 yathā nabho-maṇḍale paścāt tataḥ ālikhitasya cakrasya paridhiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Colui che del cammin sì poco piglia 110 dinanzi a me, Toscana sonò tutta; 111 e ora a pena in Siena sen pispiglia,
112 ond’ era sire quando fu distrutta 113 la rabbia fiorentina, che superba 114 fu a quel tempo sì com’ ora è putta.
query.result:
**English:**
109 He who takes so little of the road 110 before me, was once all Tuscany; 111 and now hardly a whisper of him is heard in Siena,
112 where he was lord when the Florentine rage, 113 which was so proud at that time, was destroyed, 114 just as now it is a harlot.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Yaḥ puruṣaḥ ayam mārgasya alpam eva gṛhṇāti 110 mama agre, sa sarvā Tuṣkāra-deśaḥ āsīt; 111 atha vā etarhi Siennā-nagare 'pi tasya kiñcid eva śruyate,
112 yatra sa īśvaraḥ āsīt yadā Fiorentina-krodhaḥ, yaḥ abhimānī 113 tadā kāle āsīt yathā adhunā veśyā, sa vinaṣṭaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 La vostra nominanza è color d’erba, 116 che viene e va, e quei la discolora 117 per cui ella esce de la terra acerba».
query.result:
**English:**
115 Your fame is like the color of grass, 116 which comes and goes, and that one discolors it 117 from which it emerges from the bitter earth.
**Sanskrit:**
115 Bhavatām kīrtiḥ trṇavarṇā, 116 Yā āgacchati gacchati ca, sā ca viparināmayati 117 Yataḥ sā niḥsarati kṣiterapakyāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 E io a lui: «Tuo vero dir m’incora 119 bona umiltà, e gran tumor m’appiani; 120 ma chi è quei di cui tu parlavi ora?».
query.result:
**English:**
118 And I to him: "Your true words 119 encourage me, and your great authority 120 humbles me; but who is he of whom you were just speaking?".
**Sanskrit:**
118 Aham ca tasmai: "Tava satyam vacaḥ 119 śubhāvinayaḥ, mahān ca garvaḥ mayā vinīyate; 120 kaḥ sa tu, yasya tvam adhunā āha?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 «Quelli è», rispuose, «Provenzan Salvani; 122 ed è qui perché fu presuntüoso 123 a recar Siena tutta a le sue mani.
query.result:
**English:**
121 "That one is," he replied, "Provenzan Salvani; 122 and he is here because he was presumptuous 123 in wanting to recall all of Siena to his rule."
**Sanskrit:**
121 "Saḥ," iti pratyāha, "Provenzānaḥ Sālvānī; 122 atra ca vartate, yataḥ sa ātmānam abhimānī kṛtvā 123 Sarvām eva Siyenīm ātmanaḥ prabhāve ānayitum icchati sma."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Ito è così e va, sanza riposo, 125 poi che morì; cotal moneta rende 126 a sodisfar chi è di là troppo oso».
query.result:
**English:**
124 Thus it is and goes, without rest, 125 after he dies; such coin does he render 126 to satisfy him who is too bold over there.
**Sanskrit:**
124 Evam eva bhavati, gacchati ca, anivāryamāṇam, 125 tataḥ mṛte sati; evamvidhaṃ dhanaṃ prayacchati 126 tatra atiśauryaṃ kurvataḥ kāmaṃ pūrayitum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 E io: «Se quello spirito ch’attende, 128 pria che si penta, l’orlo de la vita, 129 qua giù dimora e qua sù non ascende,
130 se buona orazïon lui non aita, 131 prima che passi tempo quanto visse, 132 come fu la venuta lui largita?».
query.result:
**English:**
127 And I: "If that spirit which awaits, 128 before it repents, the end of life, 129 dwells down here and does not ascend above,
130 if good prayers do not help it, 131 before as much time passes as it lived, 132 how was its coming here granted to it?".
**Sanskrit:**
127 Aham ca: "Yadi sa ātmā yaḥ pratipadyate, 128 prāyaścittam kṛtvā, antaṃ jīvanasya, 129 atraiva niṣedati na ca ūrdhvaṃ ārohati,
130 yadi śubhāḥ prārthanāḥ tasmai na saṃrakṣaṇam kurvanti, 131 pūrvam yat samayaḥ tasya jīvanasya āsīt, 132 katham tasya āgamanaṃ atra dattam abhūt?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Più non dirò, e scuro so che parlo; 140 ma poco tempo andrà, che ’ tuoi vicini 141 faranno sì che tu potrai chiosarlo.
query.result:
**English:**
139 I will say no more, and I know that I speak obscurely; 140 but a little while will pass, and your neighbors 141 will make it so that you will be able to interpret it.
**Sanskrit:**
139 Adhikaṃ na vakṣyāmi, jānāmi ca guḍham mayā ucyate; 140 alpam eva kālam gamyiṣyati, yatra tava prativāsinaḥ 141 tathā kariṣyanti, yena tvam śakyase tad vivaraṇam kartum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Quest’ opera li tolse quei confini».
query.result:
**English:**
142 This work removed those boundaries from them.
**Sanskrit:**
142 Etad karma tāṃs tān parimāṇān apahinoti.
